str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lystra, a place in Asia Minor.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
Of persons: incapable; of things: impossible; either the inability, or that which is impossible. Passively, impossible.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.
Lame, deprived of a foot, limping. Apparently a primary word; 'halt', i.e. Limping.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
From koilos; a cavity, i.e. the abdomen; by implication, the matrix; figuratively, the heart.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular

str2: Never. From oude and pote; not even at any time, i.e. Never at all.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
